page.title: 03TRANSPORT (CONT)
page.content: THE OPENING OF THE MOTORWAY HAS HELPED TO ATTRACT NEW INDUSTRY TO THE TOWN AND TO ENCOURAGE THE CONSTRUCTION OF NEW PRIVATE HOUSING ESTATES ON THE OUT SKIRTS OF THE TOWN AS MANY PEOPLE WHO TRAVEL IN THE COURSE OF THEIR WORK e.g SALES REPRESENTATIVES ARE ATTRACTED BY THE EASE OF ACCESS TO THE MOTORWAY SYSTEM.IMMEDIATELY TO THE SOUTH OF THE TOWN RUNS THE A71 THE MAIN AYR TO EDINBURGH TRUNK ROAD WHICH MEANS LARKHALL BENEFITS FROM ITS LOCATION AT THE JUNCTION OF MAJOR NORTH-SOUTH AND EAST_SOUTH ROUTES. THE PRESENCE OF MINING IN THE PAST MEANT THAT THE AREA WAS WELL SERVED BY RAILWAYS.HOWEVER WITH THE DECLINE OF THE INDUSTRY AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF PUBLIC AND PRIVATE ROAD TRANSPORT LARKHALLS RAILWAYS WERE CLOSED IN 1968.
